results.authors: By Hideki Suzuki, Taro Fuse, Eyk Henning, and David Carnevali
results.headline: Bosch Said to Lead Bidding for JCI Air Conditioning Assets
results.summary: Robert Bosch GmbH is emerging as the front-runner to acquire a portfolio of heating and ventilation assets being sold by Johnson Controls International Plc, people with knowledge of the matter said.

results.headline: OpenAI, Google and Anthropic Try Building AI That Can Reason
results.summary: As with so much of AI, the concept of reasoning is difficult to define and measure.

results.authors: By Margi Murphy and Katrina Manson
results.headline: FBI Used New Cellebrite Software to Access Trump Shooter’s Phone
results.summary: The FBI was given access to unreleased technology to access the phone of the man identified as the shooter of former President Donald Trump, according to people familiar with the investigation.

results.authors: By Kurt Schussler and Winnie Hsu
results.headline: TSMC, Tokyo Electron Lead Tech Selloff in Asia on Trade Angst
results.summary: Asian technology stocks fell for a second day on concerns over risks of tighter US curbs on semiconductor sales to China.

results.headline: Temasek-Backed Chip-Gear Maker Nearfield Raises €135 Million
results.summary: Dutch chip-machine maker Nearfield Instruments BV raised €135 million ($148 million) from investors including Temasek Holdings Pte as the artificial-intelligence boom drives demand for the industry.

results.authors: By Ian King and Debby Wu
results.headline: Nvidia, TSMC, Samsung and Intel: How ‘Chip War’ Puts Nations in Tech Arms Race
results.summary: Computer chips are the engine room of the digital economy, and their growing capabilities are enabling technologies such as generative artificial intelligence that promise to transform multiple industries. Their critical role was highlighted when the coronavirus pandemic disrupted chip production in Asia, tipping global technology supply chains into chaos. Small wonder, then, that the devices are now the focus of intense competition between the world’s economic superpowers.

results.headline: Ambani's $600 Million Wedding Is Business as Usual
results.summary: A five-month-long display of wealth and power marks the Indian tycoon as a media mogul and sets the stage for a public float of his digital empire.

results.headline: UK Watchdogs Probe Competitiveness of Big Tech’s Digital Wallets
results.summary: UK regulators are probing the competitiveness of digital wallets provided by the likes of Apple Inc., Alphabet Inc.’s Google and PayPal Holdings Inc. as well as what risks these new technologies bring for the consumers and businesses that rely on them.

results.headline: CFOs Peel Back the Layers on Second-Quarter Earnings
results.summary: Plus, investing in Bitcoin at Block.

results.headline: Data Sovereignty Wars Are Missing the Point
results.summary: Both governments and tech companies should come clean about why they’re collecting so much data on citizens and how they are using it.
